title: Conditional Logic
description: Use CASE statements to categorize citizens by age group dynamically within your query.
story: Create an age distribution report! Use CASE to classify citizens as 'Young' (<30), 'Adult' (30-50), or 'Senior' (>50) without modifying the table.
hint: CASE WHEN age < 30 THEN 'Young' WHEN age <= 50 THEN 'Adult' ELSE 'Senior' END AS age_group
tableSetup: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS citizens CASCADE;
CREATE TABLE citizens (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), age INT, district VARCHAR(50));
